intro: Parinari papuana subsp. whitei, commonly known as the Papuan parinari, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in lowland and hill forest habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native region.
